articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Pastor asks Easter celebrants to worship with social distancing
articles.description: Coronavirus fears rise as Easter approaches, as experts fear holiday gatherings and church services may spread the virus further. Reverend Raphael Warnock joins Joy Reid to discuss saying, 'We ought not worship the building. We need people to be safe.'

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Why is Trump touting unproven anti-malaria drug as virus cure?
articles.description: Donald Trump promoting the unproven anti-malaria drug hydroxychloroquine as a coronavirus cure alarms many experts. Why does the present continue to tout it, despite the potential dangers? Joy Reid and her panel discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Systemic racism, lack of insurance fuel coronavirus racial divide
articles.description: The coronavirus pandemic response of the Donald Trump administration, the disproportionate impact of the coronavirus on people of color, and the negative impact of the pervasive lack of healthcare coverage in some parts of the U.S. are discussed by Joy Reid a…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: U.S. now has the most coronavirus deaths, surpassing Italy
articles.description: NEW: US now leads the world in number of deaths from the coronavirus, having surpassed Italy on Saturday with more than 19,000 deaths from COVID-19 in the US.

articles.title: Cuomo: It 'makes no sense' to close New York City schools without considering other areas
articles.description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo said that Mayor Bill de Blasio's decision to close schools amid the coronavirus outbreak "makes no sense" if he did not consider other localities in the metropolitan area.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Cuomo dismisses calls to replace Biden in presidential race as 'irrelevant'
articles.description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo said that the calls for him to consider replacing Joe Biden as the Democratic nominee in the 2020 presidential race are "flattering" but "irrelevant."

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Gov. Cuomo is getting 'best minds' together to assess how to reopen New York
articles.description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo said a team of the "best minds" would be assembled to examine how to reopen the state and prevent a possible second wave of the coronavirus outbreak.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Experts say there cannot be a reopening of the U.S. economy without mass testing
articles.description: The key to getting people in the U.S. back to work and school is widespread, national testing to see who’s infected with the coronavirus and who has immunity from past infection. But less than one percent of the U.S. population has been tested, and antibody t…

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: All In 4/10/20
articles.description: Chris Hayes discusses the day's top political news.

articles.title: Rachel Maddow 4/10/20
articles.description: Watch the full episode of Friday night's The Rachel Maddow Show.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Trump admin ignoring dire COVID-19 situation in US nursing homes
articles.description: Andy Slavitt, former administrator of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, talks with Rachel Maddow about the threat of COVID-19 to U.S. nursing homes and log term care facilities and what steps the federal government should be taking to protect th…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Overwhelmed hospitals mean overwhelming conditions for medical workers
articles.description: Dr. Ernest Patti, senior emergency medicine physician at St. Barnabas Hospital in New York, talks with Rachel Maddow about the conditions in an emergency room working at capacity to keep up with overwhelming numbers of COVID-19 patients.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Meacham on why America could use the spirit of FDR right now
articles.description: Presidential historian Jon Meacham reacts to the leadership we're seeing from the White House and compares it to the leadership that America saw from FDR during the Great Depression.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: School principal delivers student lunches during COVID-19 closure
articles.description: MSNBC's Brian Williams talks to South Carolina elementary school principal Brian Williams about his efforts to stay connected with his students and the importance of making sure they are all well fed during the coronavirus school closures.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Fauci: Hope to see 'real degree of normality" by November election
articles.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci, Director of the National Institute for Allergy and Infectious Disease, talks about the likelihood that Americans will see some kind of a return to normal by the November election.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Economic tolls grows as millions file for unemployment, food bank lines grow
articles.description: Betsey Stevenson tells Ali Velshi that the 6-7 million who filed for unemployment per week might not represent how many are actually trying to file, but what the system can handle. Jared Bernstein says the growing food bank lines is a stark reminder that many…

articles.title: Fmr. Colorado governor says at a federal level, government is ‘not delivering’
articles.description: Fmr. Colorado Gov. John Hickenlooper tells Ali Velshi he commends several of the nation’s governors and their early response to coronavirus, adding “that kind of leadership, taking this seriously from the beginning, is what Colorado needed and what the

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Fauci: Coronavirus testing is just part of what we need
articles.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci, Director of the National Institute for Allergy and Infectious Disease, joins to discuss the latest on the government response to the coronavirus pandemic.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump lauds his coronavirus response as U.S. death toll hits a new high
articles.description: As deaths spikes and governors warn of more tough days ahead, Trump talks up reopening the country and spreads misinformation at a marathon press conference at the White House.
